brief.content-text:
Two Diagrams

Diagram 1, Image

The diagram depicts a small network. A local client, DNS server (DNS TEST.svr.example.com, IP address 192.168.254.32), and a computer with the name cisco.netacad.net and IP address of 209.165.200.224. The local client, using n s lookup from a Windows command line, sends a DNS Query cisco.netacad.net to DNS TEST.svr.example.com, which in turn tries to resolve the name to the corresponding IP. It then responds to the local client with its own name and IP address, and lists an IP address for cisco.netacad.net of 209.165.200.224 as a non-authoritative answer. This allows the user at the local client to determine which DNS server is being used and which IP address the DNS server has associated with the DNS name cisco.netacad.net.
